Texas blues troubadour Hadden Sayers didnÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢t follow the usual script. His tribulations werenÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢t the result of personal demons. He didnÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢t call on a team of slick advisors and publicists to resuscitate his career. He didnÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢t look for reality shows, sex tapes, or reunion tours to make an easy buck. Hadden Sayers knew that sometimes an honest dollar is a hard dollar.
Blues power guitarist Hadden Sayers has bent more strings to earn a Hard Dollar than most and his music proves it. Tough to the point of indestructible, yet pliant and vulnerable when required, it is the story of a man who has hit lifeÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s roadblocks head on and emerged unbowed and unbroken. Best of all, like all great art that tells the truth, it could be everyoneÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s story. With his road-tested combo of Tony McClung (drums), Mark Frye (bass, Fender Rhodes) and Dave DeWitt (Hammond B-3, Wurlitzer and piano) sharp as mesquite cactus, Sayers has penned 13 numbers guaranteed to bring his career good luck.
